======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-6190
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-6190
Phase: Assigned (20071129)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://www.hack.lu/pres/hacklu07_Remote_wiretapping.pdf
Reference: CISCO:20071128 Cisco Unified IP Phone Remote Eavesdropping
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_response09186a0080903a6d.html
Reference: BID:26668
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/26668
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2007-4036
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2007/4036
Reference: OSVDB:40874
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/40874
Reference: SECTRACK:1019006
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1019006
Reference: SECUNIA:27829
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/27829

The HTTP daemon in the Cisco Unified IP Phone, when the Extension
Mobility feature is enabled, allows remote authenticated users of
other phones associated with the same CUCM server to eavesdrop on the
physical environment via a CiscoIPPhoneExecute message containing a
URL attribute of an ExecuteItem element that specifies a Real-Time
Transport Protocol (RTP) audio stream.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-6708
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-6708
Phase: Assigned (20080313)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080301 The Router Hacking Challenge is Over!
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/489009/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.gnucitizen.org/blog/persistent-xss-and-csrf-on-wireless-g-adsl-gateway-with-speedbooster-wag54gs/
Reference: MISC:http://www.gnucitizen.org/projects/router-hacking-challenge/
Reference: OSVDB:43537
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/43537
Reference: OSVDB:43538
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/43538
Reference: XF:linksys-wag54gs-setup-csfr(41269)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/41269

Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities on the
Cisco Linksys WAG54GS Wireless-G ADSL Gateway with 1.01.03 and earlier
firmware allow remote attackers to perform actions as administrators
via an arbitrary valid request to an administrative URI, as
demonstrated by (1) a Restore Factory Defaults action using the
mtenRestore parameter to setup.cgi and (2) creation of a user account
using the sysname parameter to setup.cgi.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2007-6709
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2007-6709
Phase: Assigned (20080313)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080301 The Router Hacking Challenge is Over!

The Cisco Linksys WAG54GS Wireless-G ADSL Gateway with 1.01.03 and
earlier firmware has "admin" as its default password for the "admin"
account, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access.

Name: CVE-2008-0029
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-0029
Phase: Assigned (20071217)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20080123 Default Passwords in the Application Velocity System

Reference: BID:27421
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/27421
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-0260

Reference: SECTRACK:1019259
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1019259
Reference: XF:ciscoavs-default-password-admin-account(39860)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/39860

Cisco Application Velocity System (AVS) before 5.1.0 is installed with
default passwords for some system accounts, which allows remote
attackers to gain privileges.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30574
Reference: SECUNIA:30596
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30596
Reference: SECUNIA:30626
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30626
Reference: SECUNIA:30647
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30647
Reference: SECUNIA:30648

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30665
Reference: SECUNIA:30802
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30802
Reference: SECUNIA:31334
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31334
Reference: SECUNIA:31351
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31351
Reference: SECUNIA:31467
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31467
Reference: SECUNIA:31568
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31568
Reference: SECUNIA:30612
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30612
Reference: SECUNIA:30615
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30615
Reference: SECUNIA:32664
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/32664
Reference: SREASON:3933
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3933
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-1612
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/1612

SNMPv3 HMAC verification in (1) Net-SNMP 5.2.x before 5.2.4.1, 5.3.x
before 5.3.2.1, and 5.4.x before 5.4.1.1; (2) UCD-SNMP; (3) eCos; (4)
Juniper Session and Resource Control (SRC) C-series 1.0.0 through
2.0.0; (5) NetApp (aka Network Appliance) Data ONTAP 7.3RC1 and
7.3RC2; (6) SNMP Research before 16.2; (7) multiple Cisco IOS, CatOS,
ACE, and Nexus products; (8) Ingate Firewall 3.1.0 and later and
SIParator 3.1.0 and later; (9) HP OpenView SNMP Emanate Master Agent
15.x; and possibly other products relies on the client to specify the
HMAC length, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass SNMP
authentication via a length value of 1, which only checks the first
byte.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2008-1246
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-1246
Phase: Assigned (20080310)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080301 The Router Hacking Challenge is Over!
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/489009/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080124 PIX Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/486938
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080124 Re: PIX Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/486959
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080125 Re: Re: PIX Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/487051
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20080205 Re: Re: PIX Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/487579
Reference: MISC:http://hackathology.blogspot.com/2008/01/pixasa-finesse-71-72-privilege.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.gnucitizen.org/projects/router-hacking-challenge/
Reference: BID:27457
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/27457
Reference: XF:cisco-pixasa-privilege-escalation(41129)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/41129

** DISPUTED **

The Cisco PIX/ASA Finesse Operation System 7.1 and 7.2 allows local
users to gain privileges by entering characters at the enable prompt,
erasing these characters via the Backspace key, and then holding down
the Backspace key for one second after erasing the final
character. NOTE: third parties, including one who works for the
vendor, have been unable to reproduce the flaw unless the enable
password is blank.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECUNIA:33714
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/33714
Reference: SECUNIA:33786
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/33786
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-0622
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/0622
Reference: XF:win-dns-client-server-spoofing(43334)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/43334
Reference: XF:cisco-multiple-dns-cache-poisoning(43637)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/43637

The DNS protocol, as implemented in (1) BIND 8 and 9 before 9.5.0-P1,
9.4.2-P1, and 9.3.5-P1; (2) Microsoft DNS in Windows 2000 SP4, XP SP2
and SP3, and Server 2003 SP1 and SP2; and other implementations allow
remote attackers to spoof DNS traffic via a birthday attack that uses
in-bailiwick referrals to conduct cache poisoning against recursive
resolvers, related to insufficient randomness of DNS transaction IDs
and source ports, aka "DNS Insufficient Socket Entropy Vulnerability"
or "the Kaminsky bug."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30249
Reference: SECUNIA:30361
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30361
Reference: SECUNIA:30230
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30230
Reference: SECUNIA:31531
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31531
Reference: SECUNIA:31882
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31882
Reference: SECUNIA:30086
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/30086
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2008-1630
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2008/1630/references
Reference: XF:openssh-sshd-session-hijacking(41438)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/41438

OpenSSH 4.3p2, and probably other versions, allows local users to
hijack forwarded X connections by causing ssh to set DISPLAY to :10,
even when another process is listening on the associated port, as
demonstrated by opening TCP port 6010 (IPv4) and sniffing a cookie
sent by Emacs.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Phase: Assigned (20080527)
Category:

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/495937/100/0/threaded
Reference: CISCO:20080903 Cisco Security Response: Cisco Secure ACS Denial Of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20080903-csacs.shtml
Reference: BID:30997
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/30997
Reference: SECTRACK:1020814
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1020814
Reference: SECUNIA:31731
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/31731
Reference: SREASON:4216
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/4216
Reference: XF:cisco-sacs-eap-dos(44871)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/44871

Cisco Secure ACS 3.x before 3.3(4) Build 12 patch 7, 4.0.x, 4.1.x
before 4.1(4) Build 13 Patch 11, and 4.2.x before 4.2(0) Build 124
Patch 4 does not properly handle an EAP Response packet in which the
value of the length field exceeds the actual packet length, which
allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service
(CSRadius and CSAuth service crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code
via a crafted RADIUS (1) EAP-Response/Identity, (2) EAP-Response/MD5,
or (3) EAP-Response/TLS Message Attribute packet.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Unspecified vulnerability in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)
implementation in Cisco IOS 12.2 through 12.4, when VoIP is
configured, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(device reload) via unspecified valid SIP messages, aka Cisco bug ID
CSCsk42759, a different vulnerability than CVE-2008-3800 and
CVE-2008-3801.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category:

Label Switching (MPLS) VPN with extended communities is configured,
sometimes causes a corrupted route target (RT) to be used, which
allows remote attackers to read traffic from other VPNs in
opportunistic circumstances.

(3) Microsoft Windows, (4) Cisco products, and probably other
operating systems allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(connection queue exhaustion) via multiple vectors that manipulate
information in the TCP state table, as demonstrated by sockstress.

Name: CVE-2008-5230
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2008-5230
Phase: Assigned (20081125)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[dailydave] 20081107 All Ur WiFi(WPA) R Belong 2 PacSec
Reference: URL:http://lists.immunitysec.com/pipermail/dailydave/2008-November/005413.html
Reference: MISC:http://arstechnica.com/articles/paedia/wpa-cracked.ars
Reference: MISC:http://dl.aircrack-ng.org/breakingwepandwpa.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://radajo.blogspot.com/2008/11/wpatkip-chopchop-attack.html

Reference: MISC:http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=tkiptun-ng
Reference: CISCO:20081121 Cisco Response to TKIP Encryption Weakness
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_response09186a0080a30036.html
Reference: BID:32164
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/32164

The Temporal Key Integrity Protocol (TKIP) implementation in
unspecified Cisco products and other vendors' products, as used in WPA
and WPA2 on Wi-Fi networks, has insufficient countermeasures against
certain crafted and replayed packets, which makes it easier for remote
attackers to decrypt packets from an access point (AP) to a client and
spoof packets from an AP to a client, and conduct ARP poisoning
attacks or other attacks, as demonstrated by tkiptun-ng.

Name: CVE-2009-0630
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0630
Phase: Assigned (20090218)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080a90469.shtml
Reference: CISCO:20090325 Cisco IOS Software Multiple Features IP Sockets Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080a904c6.shtml
Reference: BID:34242
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/34242
Reference: SECTRACK:1021897
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1021897
Reference: SECUNIA:34438
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34438
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-0851
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/0851
Reference: XF:ios-ipsockets-dos(49418)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/49418

The (1) Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express; (2) SIP Gateway
Signaling Support Over Transport Layer Security (TLS) Transport; (3)
Secure Signaling and Media Encryption; (4) Blocks Extensible Exchange
Protocol (BEEP); (5) Network Admission Control HTTP Authentication
Proxy; (6) Per-user URL Redirect for EAPoUDP, Dot1x, and MAC
Authentication Bypass; (7) Distributed Director with HTTP Redirects;
and (8) TCP DNS features in Cisco IOS 12.0 through 12.4 do not
properly handle IP sockets, which allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (outage or resource consumption) via a series of
crafted TCP packets.

Phase: Assigned (20090218)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080a90469.shtml
Reference: CISCO:20090325 Cisco IOS Software Multiple Features Crafted UDP Packet Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080a90426.shtml
Reference: BID:34245
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/34245

Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:6720

Reference: XF:ios-udp-dos(49419)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/49419

Unspecified vulnerability in Cisco IOS 12.0 through 12.4, when
configured with (1) IP Service Level Agreements (SLAs) Responder, (2)
Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), (3) H.323 Annex E Call Signaling
Transport, or (4) Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (blocked input queue on the
inbound interface) via a crafted UDP packet.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-0632
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-0632
Phase: Assigned (20090218)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20090311 Cisco Unified Communications Manager IP Phone Personal Address Book Synchronizer Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080a8643c.shtml
Reference: CISCO:20090311 Identifying and Mitigating Exploitation of the Cisco Unified Communications Manager IP Phone Personal Address Book Synchronizer Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_applied_mitigation_bulletin09186a0080a86434.html
Reference: BID:34082
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/34082
Reference: OSVDB:52589
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/52589
Reference: SECTRACK:1021839
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1021839
Reference: SECUNIA:34238
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/34238
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-0675
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/0675
Reference: XF:cucm-pab-privilege-escalation(49196)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/49196

The IP Phone Personal Address Book (PAB) Synchronizer feature in Cisco
Unified Communications Manager (aka CUCM, formerly CallManager) 4.1,
4.2 before 4.2(3)SR4b, 4.3 before 4.3(2)SR1b, 5.x before 5.1(3e), 6.x
before 6.1(3), and 7.0 before 7.0(2) sends privileged
directory-service account credentials to the client in cleartext,
which allows remote attackers to modify the CUCM configuration and
perform other privileged actions by intercepting these credentials,
and then using them in requests unrelated to the intended
synchronization task, as demonstrated by (1) DC Directory account
credentials in CUCM 4.x and (2) TabSyncSysUser account credentials in
CUCM 5.x through 7.x.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2082
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2082

Cisco IOS 12.0(32)S12 through 12.0(32)S13 and 12.0(33)S3 through
12.0(33)S4, 12.0(32)SY8 through 12.0(32)SY9, 12.2(33)SXI1 through
12.2(33)SXI2, 12.2XNC before 12.2(33)XNC2, 12.2XND before
12.2(33)XND1, and 12.4(24)T1; and IOS XE 2.3 through 2.3.1t and 2.4
through 2.4.0; when RFC4893 BGP routing is enabled, allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (device reload) by using an
RFC4271 peer to send a malformed update, aka Bug ID CSCta33973.

Name: CVE-2009-2631
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2631
Phase: Assigned (20090728)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20091202 Same-origin policy bypass vulnerabilities in several VPN products reported
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/508164/100/0/threaded
Reference: FULLDISC:20060608 SSL VPNs and security
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2006/Jun/238
Reference: FULLDISC:20060609 Re: SSL VPNs and security
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2006/Jun/269
Reference: FULLDISC:20060609 Re: SSL VPNs and security
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2006/Jun/270
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.sonicwall.com/us/2123_14882.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.sonicwall.com/us/2123_14883.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.stonesoft.com/en/support/security_advisories/2009_03_12.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://kb.juniper.net/KB15799
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.nortel.com/go/main.jsp?cscat=BLTNDETAIL&DocumentOID=984744
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www116.nortel.com/pub/repository/CLARIFY/DOCUMENT/2009/50/025367-01.pdf
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#261869
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/261869
Reference: BID:37152
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/37152
Reference: SECTRACK:1023255
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1023255
Reference: SECUNIA:37696
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37696
Reference: SECUNIA:37786
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37786
Reference: SECUNIA:37788
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37788
Reference: SECUNIA:37789
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37789
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3567
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3567
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3568
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3568
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3569
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3569
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3570
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3570
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3571
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3571
Reference: XF:sslvpn-sameorigin-security-bypass(54523)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/54523

Multiple clientless SSL VPN products that run in web browsers,
including Stonesoft StoneGate; Cisco ASA; SonicWALL E-Class SSL VPN
and SonicWALL SSL VPN; SafeNet SecureWire Access Gateway; Juniper
Networks Secure Access; Nortel CallPilot; Citrix Access Gateway; and
other products, when running in configurations that do not restrict
access to the same domain as the VPN, retrieve the content of remote
URLs from one domain and rewrite them so they originate from the VPN's
domain, which violates the same origin policy and allows remote
attackers to conduct cross-site scripting attacks, read cookies that
originated from other domains, access the Web VPN session to gain
access to internal resources, perform key logging, and conduct other
attacks.  NOTE: it could be argued that this is a fundamental design
problem in any clientless VPN solution, as opposed to a
commonly-introduced error that can be fixed in separate
implementations. Therefore a single CVE has been assigned for all
products that have this design.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2861

Lightweight Access Point 1100 and 1200 devices does not properly
implement access-point association, which allows remote attackers to
spoof a controller and cause a denial of service (service outage) via
crafted remote radio management (RRM) packets, aka "SkyJack" or Bug ID
CSCtb56664.

Cisco Unified Border Element feature is enabled, allows remote

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2759
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2759

Cisco IOS 12.0 through 12.4, when IP-based tunnels and the Cisco
Express Forwarding feature are enabled, allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (device reload) via a malformed packet that
is not properly handled during switching from one tunnel to a second
tunnel, aka Bug IDs CSCsh97579 and CSCsq31776.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2976
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2976
Phase: Assigned (20090827)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://www.airmagnet.com/assets/AM_Technote_SkyJack_082509.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://www.airmagnet.com/news/press_releases/2009/08252009.php
Reference: SECTRACK:1022774
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1022774

Cisco Aironet Lightweight Access Point (AP) devices send the contents
of certain multicast data frames in cleartext, which allows remote
attackers to discover Wireless LAN Controller MAC addresses and IP
addresses, and AP configuration details, by sniffing the wireless
network.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-2977
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2977
Phase: Assigned (20090827)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090821 Clear Text Storage of Password in CS-MARS v6.0.4 and Earlier
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/505995/100/0/threaded
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20090821 Re: Clear Text Storage of Password in CS-MARS v6.0.4 and Earlier
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/505998/100/0/threaded
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/Support/BugToolKit/search/getBugDetails.do?method=fetchBugDetails&bugId=CSCtb52450
Reference: BID:36098
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/36098
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2364
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2364
Reference: XF:csmars-sysbacktrace-info-disclosure(52913)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/52913

The Cisco Security Monitoring, Analysis and Response System (CS-MARS)
6.0.4 and earlier stores cleartext passwords in log/sysbacktrace.##
files within error-logs.tar.gz archives, which allows
context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading
these files.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/506716/100/0/threaded
Reference: FULLDISC:20090924 Cisco ACE XML Gateway <= 6.0 Internal IP disclosure
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2009/Sep/0369.html
Reference: MISC:http://www.brainoverflow.org/advisories/cisco_ace_xml_gw_ip_disclosure.txt
Reference: CISCO:20090925 Unmatched Request Discloses Client Internal IP Address
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_response09186a0080af8965.html
Reference: BID:36522
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/36522
Reference: SECTRACK:1022949
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1022949
Reference: SECUNIA:36879
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/36879
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-2778
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/2778
Reference: XF:cisco-ace-ipaddress-info-disclosure(53482)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/53482

Cisco ACE XML Gateway (AXG) and ACE Web Application Firewall (WAF)
before 6.1 allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via
an HTTP request that lacks a handler, as demonstrated by (1) an
OPTIONS request or (2) a crafted GET request, leading to a
Message-handling Errors message containing a certain client intranet
IP address, aka Bug ID CSCtb82159.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-2010
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/2010
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-2745
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/2745
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-3069
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/3069
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-3086
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/3086
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-3126
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/3126
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0032
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0032
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0033
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0033
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2011-0086
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2011/0086
Reference: XF:tls-renegotiation-weak-security(54158)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/54158

The TLS protocol, and the SSL protocol 3.0 and possibly earlier, as
used in Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.0, mod_ssl in
the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.14 and earlier, OpenSSL before 0.9.8l,
GnuTLS 2.8.5 and earlier, Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS)
3.12.4 and earlier, multiple Cisco products, and other products, does
not properly associate renegotiation handshakes with an existing
connection, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to insert data
into HTTPS sessions, and possibly other types of sessions protected by
TLS or SSL, by sending an unauthenticated request that is processed
retroactively by a server in a post-renegotiation context, related to
a "plaintext injection" attack, aka the "Project Mogul" issue.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-4118
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-4118
Phase: Assigned (20091130)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.org/0911-exploits/sybsec-adv17.txt
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=19445
Reference: BID:37077
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/37077
Reference: SECUNIA:37419
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37419
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3296
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3296

The StartServiceCtrlDispatcher function in the cvpnd service
(cvpnd.exe) in Cisco VPN client for Windows before 5.0.06.0100 does
not properly handle an ERROR_FAILED_SERVICE_CONTROLLER_CONNECT error,
which allows local users to cause a denial of service (service crash
and VPN connection loss) via a manual start of cvpnd.exe while the
cvpnd service is running.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2009-4455
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-4455
Phase: Assigned (20091229)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20091217 [ISecAuditors Security Advisories] Cisco ASA <= 8.x VPN SSL module Clientless URL-list control bypass
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/508530/100/0/threaded
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=19609
Reference: OSVDB:61132
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/61132
Reference: SECTRACK:1023368
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1023368
Reference: SECUNIA:37710
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/37710
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2009-3577
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2009/3577

The default configuration of Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security
Appliance (Cisco ASA) 7.0, 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, 8.1, and 8.2 allows portal
traffic to access arbitrary backend servers, which might allow remote
authenticated users to bypass intended access restrictions and access
unauthorized web sites via a crafted URL obfuscated with ROT13 and a
certain encoding.  NOTE: this issue was originally reported as a
vulnerability related to lack of restrictions to URLs listed in the
Cisco WebVPN bookmark component, but the vendor states that "The
bookmark feature is not a security feature."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Desktop (CSD) before 3.5.841 does not properly verify the signatures
of downloaded programs, which allows remote attackers to force the

Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/0965

The Cisco RVS4000 4-port Gigabit Security Router before 1.3.2.0,
PVC2300 Business Internet Video Camera before 1.1.2.6, WVC200
Wireless-G PTZ Internet Video Camera before 1.1.1.15, WVC210
Wireless-G PTZ Internet Video Camera before 1.1.1.15, and WVC2300
Wireless-G Business Internet Video Camera before 1.1.2.6 do not
properly restrict read access to passwords, which allows
context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information, related
to (1) access by remote authenticated users to a PVC2300 or WVC2300
via a crafted URL, (2) leveraging setup privileges on a WVC200 or
WVC210, and (3) leveraging administrative privileges on an RVS4000,
aka Bug ID CSCte64726.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-0642
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0642
Phase: Assigned (20100217)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:11403
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/11403
Reference: BID:38202
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/38202
Reference: XF:ccs-files-information-disclosure(56221)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/56221

Cisco Collaboration Server (CCS) 5 allows remote attackers to read the
source code of JHTML files via URL encoded characters in the filename
extension, as demonstrated by (1) changing .jhtml to %2Ejhtml, (2)
changing .jhtml to .jhtm%6C, (3) appending %00 after .jhtml, and (4)
appending %c0%80 after .jhtml, related to the (a) doc/docindex.jhtml,
(b) browserId/wizardForm.jhtml, (c) webline/html/forms/callback.jhtml,
(d) webline/html/forms/callbackICM.jhtml, (e)
webline/html/agent/AgentFrame.jhtml, (f)
webline/html/agent/default/badlogin.jhtml, (g) callme/callForm.jhtml,
(h) webline/html/multichatui/nowDefunctWindow.jhtml, (i)
browserId/wizard.jhtml, (j) admin/CiscoAdmin.jhtml, (k)
msccallme/mscCallForm.jhtml, and (l)
webline/html/admin/wcs/LoginPage.jhtml components.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Phase: Assigned (20100427)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20100511 Cisco IronPort Desktop Flag Plug-in for Outlook Information Disclosure
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_response09186a0080b2c505.html

The Send Secure functionality in the Cisco IronPort Desktop Flag
Plug-in for Outlook before 6.5.0-006 does not properly handle
simultaneously composed messages, which might allow remote attackers
to obtain cleartext contents of e-mail messages that were intended to
be encrypted, aka bug 65623.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2010-1574

Reference: CERT-VN:VU#732671
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/732671
Reference: BID:41436
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41436
Reference: OSVDB:66120
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/66120
Reference: SECTRACK:1024173
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1024173
Reference: SECUNIA:40407
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/40407
Reference: VUPEN:ADV-2010-1754
Reference: URL:http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1754

series switches has (1) a community name of public for RO access and

for remote attackers to modify the configuration or obtain potentially
sensitive information via SNMP requests, aka Bug ID CSCtf25589.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-1575
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1575
Phase: Assigned (20100427)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100702 VSR Advisory: Multiple Cisco CSS / ACE Client Certificate and HTTP Header Manipulation Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/512144/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.vsecurity.com/resources/advisory/20100702-1/
Reference: BID:41315
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41315
Reference: OSVDB:66091
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/66091
Reference: SECTRACK:1024167
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1024167

The Cisco Content Services Switch (CSS) 11500 with software 08.20.1.01
conveys authentication data through ClientCert-* headers but does not
delete client-supplied ClientCert-* headers, which might allow remote
attackers to bypass authentication via crafted header data, as
demonstrated by a ClientCert-Subject-CN header, aka Bug ID CSCsz04690.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-1576
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1576
Phase: Assigned (20100427)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100702 VSR Advisory: Multiple Cisco CSS / ACE Client Certificate and HTTP Header Manipulation Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/512144/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.vsecurity.com/resources/advisory/20100702-1/
Reference: BID:41315
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41315
Reference: OSVDB:66092
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/66092
Reference: SECTRACK:1024167
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1024167
Reference: SECTRACK:1024168
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1024168

The Cisco Content Services Switch (CSS) 11500 with software before
8.20.4.02 and the Application Control Engine (ACE) 4710 with software
before A2(3.0) do not properly handle use of LF, CR, and LFCR as
alternatives to the standard CRLF sequence between HTTP headers, which
allows remote attackers to bypass intended header insertions or
conduct HTTP request smuggling attacks via crafted header data, as
demonstrated by LF characters preceding ClientCert-Subject and
ClientCert-Subject-CN headers, aka Bug ID CSCta04885.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-1870
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1870
Phase: Assigned (20100510)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:14360
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/14360
Reference: FULLDISC:20100713 CVE-2010-1870: Struts2 remote commands execution
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2010/Jul/183
Reference: MISC:http://blog.o0o.nu/2010/07/cve-2010-1870-struts2xwork-remote.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Security+Advisory+2010-06-16
Reference: CONFIRM:http://struts.apache.org/2.2.1/docs/s2-005.html
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140709-struts2
Reference: BID:41592
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41592
Reference: OSVDB:66280
Reference: URL:http://www.osvdb.org/66280
Reference: SECUNIA:59110
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59110
Reference: SREASON:8345
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8345

The OGNL extensive expression evaluation capability in XWork in Struts
2.0.0 through 2.1.8.1, as used in Atlassian Fisheye, Crucible, and
possibly other products, uses a permissive whitelist, which allows
remote attackers to modify server-side context objects and bypass the
"#" protection mechanism in ParameterInterceptors via the (1)
#context, (2) #_memberAccess, (3) #root, (4) #this, (5)
#_typeResolver, (6) #_classResolver, (7) #_traceEvaluations, (8)
#_lastEvaluation, (9) #_keepLastEvaluation, and possibly other OGNL
context variables, a different vulnerability than CVE-2008-6504.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-2025
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-2025
Phase: Assigned (20100524)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20100524 Scientific Atlanta DPC2100 WebSTAR Cable Modem vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2010-05/0322.html
Reference: BID:40346
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/40346

Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in the web
interface on the Cisco Scientific Atlanta WebSTAR DPC2100R2 cable
modem with firmware 2.0.2r1256-060303 allow remote attackers to hijack
the authentication of administrators for requests that (1) reset the
modem, (2) erase the firmware, (3) change the administrative password,
(4) install modified firmware, or (5) change the access level, as
demonstrated by a request to goform/_aslvl.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-2629
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-2629
Phase: Assigned (20100706)
Category: 
Reference: BUGTRAQ:20100702 VSR Advisory: Multiple Cisco CSS / ACE Client Certificate and HTTP Header Manipulation Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/512144/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://www.vsecurity.com/resources/advisory/20100702-1/
Reference: BID:41315
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41315
Reference: SECTRACK:1024167
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1024167
Reference: SECTRACK:1024168
Reference: URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1024168

The Cisco Content Services Switch (CSS) 11500 with software 8.20.4.02
and the Application Control Engine (ACE) 4710 with software A2(3.0) do
not properly handle LF header terminators in situations where the GET
line is terminated by CRLF, which allows remote attackers to conduct
HTTP request smuggling attacks and possibly bypass intended header
insertions via crafted header data, as demonstrated by an LF character
between the ClientCert-Subject and ClientCert-Subject-CN headers.
NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for
CVE-2010-1576.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

before 4.1(1.2) for Catalyst 6500 series switches and 7600 series
routers, when multi-mode is enabled, allows remote attackers to cause

======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-2976
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-2976
Phase: Assigned (20100809)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/wireless/controller/release/notes/crn7.0.html

The controller in Cisco Unified Wireless Network (UWN) Solution 7.x
through 7.0.98.0 has (1) a default SNMP read-only community of public,
(2) a default SNMP read-write community of private, and a value of
"default" for the (3) SNMP v3 username, (4) SNMP v3 authentication
password, and (5) SNMP v3 privacy password, which makes it easier for
remote attackers to obtain access.

Status: Candidate

Reference: FULLDISC:20101117 Cisco Unified Videoconferencing multiple vulnerabilities - CVE-2010-3037 CVE-2010-3038

3545, 5110, 5115, and 5230; Unified Videoconferencing 3527 Primary
Rate Interface (PRI) Gateway; Unified Videoconferencing 3522 Basic
Rate Interfaces (BRI) Gateway; and Unified Videoconferencing 3515
Multipoint Control Unit (MCU) uses predictable session IDs based on
time values, which makes it easier for remote attackers to hijack
sessions via a brute-force attack, aka Bug ID CSCti54048.

Gateway; Unified Videoconferencing 3522 Basic Rate Interfaces (BRI)

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-4354
Phase: Assigned (20101130)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20101129 Cisco IPSec VPN Implementation Group Name Enumeration Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_response09186a0080b5992c.html

The remote-access IPSec VPN implementation on Cisco Adaptive Security
Appliances (ASA) 5500 series devices, PIX Security Appliances 500
series devices, and VPN Concentrators 3000 series devices responds to
an Aggressive Mode IKE Phase I message only when the group name is
configured on the device, which allows remote attackers to enumerate
valid group names via a series of IKE negotiation attempts, aka Bug ID
CSCtj96108, a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-2025.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2010-4670
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-4670
Phase: Assigned (20110106)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://events.ccc.de/congress/2010/Fahrplan/events/3957.en.html
Reference: MISC:http://mirror.fem-net.de/CCC/27C3/mp3-audio-only/27c3-3957-en-ipv6_insecurities.mp3
Reference: MISC:http://mirror.fem-net.de/CCC/27C3/mp4-h264-HQ/27c3-3957-en-ipv6_insecurities.mp4
Reference: MISC:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=00yjWB6gGy8
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa82/release/notes/asarn82.pdf
Reference: BID:45760
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/45760
Reference: SECTRACK:1024963
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id?1024963
Reference: XF:asa-pix-nd-dos(64598)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/64598

The Neighbor Discovery (ND) protocol implementation in the IPv6 stack
on Cisco Adaptive Security Appliances (ASA) 5500 series devices with
software 8.2(3) and earlier, and Cisco PIX Security Appliances
devices, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU
consumption and device hang) by sending many Router Advertisement (RA)
messages with different source addresses, as demonstrated by the
flood_router6 program in the thc-ipv6 package, aka Bug ID CSCti24526.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

in Cisco IOS before 15.0(1)XA5 allows remote attackers to cause a

demonstrated by the flood_router6 program in the thc-ipv6 package, aka

Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2014/Dec/23

Reference: SECUNIA:59301
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59301
Reference: SECUNIA:59666
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59666
Reference: SECUNIA:59342
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59342

Race condition in the ssl3_read_bytes function in s3_pkt.c in OpenSSL
through 1.0.1g, when SSL_MODE_RELEASE_BUFFERS is enabled, allows
remote attackers to inject data across sessions or cause a denial of
service (use-after-free and parsing error) via an SSL connection in a
multithreaded environment.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

12.4(24)MD3, 12.4(22)MDA before 12.4(22)MDA5, and 12.4(24)MDA before
12.4(24)MDA3 on the Cisco Content Services Gateway Second Generation
(aka CSG2) allows remote attackers to bypass intended access
restrictions and intended billing restrictions by sending HTTP traffic
to a restricted destination after sending HTTP traffic to an
unrestricted destination, aka Bug ID CSCtk35917.

SV1(3b), as used in VMware ESX 4.0 and 4.1 and ESXi 4.0 and 4.1, does
not properly handle dropped packets, which allows guest OS users to
cause a denial of service (ESX or ESXi host OS crash) by sending an
802.1Q tagged packet over an access vEthernet port, aka Cisco Bug ID
CSCtj17451.

Category:

Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/archive/1/516648/100/0/threaded
Reference: MISC:http://zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-11-092/

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/65754

The CSDWebInstallerCtrl ActiveX control in CSDWebInstaller.ocx in
Cisco Secure Desktop (CSD) allows remote attackers to download an
unintended Cisco program onto a client machine, and execute this
program, by identifying a Cisco program with a Cisco digital signature
and then renaming this program to inst.exe, a different vulnerability
than CVE-2010-0589 and CVE-2011-0926.

Name: CVE-2011-0935

by leveraging an IKE peer relationship in which a key was previously

vulnerability than CVE-2010-4685.

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-0939

Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=24127
Reference: CISCO:20110928 Cisco IOS Software Session Initiation Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080b95d5a.shtml

Unspecified vulnerability in Cisco IOS 12.4, 15.0, and 15.1, and IOS
XE 2.5.x through 3.2.x, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (device reload) via a crafted SIP message, aka Bug ID
CSCth03022.

Name: CVE-2011-0941
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-0941
Phase: Assigned (20110210)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=24525
Reference: CISCO:20110928 Cisco Unified Communications Manager Memory Leak Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20110928-cucm

Memory leak in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) 6.x before
6.1(5)su2, 7.x before 7.1(5b)su3, 8.x before 8.0(3a)su1, and 8.5
before 8.5(1), and Cisco IOS 12.4 and 15.1, allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (memory consumption and process failure or
device reload) via a malformed SIP message, aka Bug IDs CSCti75128 and
CSCtj09179.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Phase: Assigned (20110210)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=24116
Reference: CISCO:20110928 Cisco IOS Software Data-Link Switching Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080b95d4e.shtml

Memory leak in the Data-link switching (aka DLSw) feature in Cisco IOS
12.1 through 12.4 and 15.0 through 15.1, and IOS XE 3.1.xS before
3.1.3S and 3.2.xS before 3.2.1S, when implemented over Fast Sequence
Transport (FST), allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(memory consumption and device reload or hang) via a crafted IP
protocol 91 packet, aka Bug ID CSCth69364.

Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080b95d4d.shtml

The NAT implementation in Cisco IOS 12.1 through 12.4 and 15.0 through
15.1, and IOS XE 3.1.xSG, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (device reload or hang) via malformed NetMeeting Directory
(aka Internet Locator Service or ILS) LDAP traffic, aka Bug ID
CSCtd10712.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-0949
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-0949
Phase: Assigned (20110210)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20110525 Cisco IOS XR Software SSHv1 Denial of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080b7f18f.shtml

Cisco IOS XR 3.6.x, 3.8.x before 3.8.3, and 3.9.x before 3.9.1 does
not properly remove sshd_lock files from /tmp/, which allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (disk consumption) by making
many SSHv1 connections, aka Bug ID CSCtd64417.

Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:17304
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/17304
Reference: FULLDISC:20110518 Cisco Unified Operations Manager Multiple Vulnerabilities - SOS-11-006
Reference: URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/fulldisclosure/2011-05/0371.html

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/67521

Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Cisco Unified
Operations Manager (CUOM) before 8.6 allow remote attackers to inject
arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) the extn parameter to
iptm/advancedfind.do, (2) the deviceInstanceName parameter to
iptm/ddv.do, the (3) cmd or (4) group parameter to iptm/eventmon, the
(5) clusterName or (6) deviceName parameter to
iptm/faultmon/ui/dojo/Main/eventmon_wrapper.jsp, or the (7) ccmName or
(8) clusterName parameter to iptm/logicalTopo.do, aka Bug ID
CSCtn61716.

embedded Apache HTTP Server component in Cisco Unified Communications
Manager (aka CUCM, formerly CallManager) 6.x before 6.1(5)su3, 7.x
before 7.1(5)su4, 8.0 before 8.0(3a)su2, and 8.5 before 8.5(1)su1
allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the (1)
f, (2) l, or (3) n parameter, aka Bug ID CSCtj42064.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

The cat6000-dot1x component in Cisco IOS 12.2 before 12.2(33)SXI7 does
not properly handle (1) a loop between a dot1x enabled port and an
open-authentication dot1x enabled port and (2) a loop between a dot1x
enabled port and a non-dot1x port, which allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (traffic storm) via unspecified vectors that
trigger many Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) Bridge Protocol Data Unit
(BPDU) frames, aka Bug ID CSCtq36327.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2011-2395
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-2395
Phase: Assigned (20110605)
Category: 
Reference: FULLDISC:20110523 Bypassing Cisco's ICMPv6 Router Advertisement Guard feature
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/May/446
Reference: SREASON:8271
Reference: URL:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/8271
Reference: XF:ciscoios-nd-security-bypass(67940)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/67940

The Neighbor Discovery (ND) protocol implementation in Cisco IOS on
unspecified switches allows remote attackers to bypass the Router
Advertisement Guarding functionality via a fragmented IPv6 packet in
which the Router Advertisement (RA) message is contained in the second
fragment, as demonstrated by (1) a packet in which the first fragment
contains a long Destination Options extension header or (2) a packet
in which the first fragment contains an ICMPv6 Echo Request message.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

TelePresence System MXP Series F9.1 and earlier allows remote
authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a
crafted Call ID, as demonstrated by resultant cross-site request
forgery (CSRF) attacks that change passwords or cause a denial of
service, aka Bug ID CSCtq46488.

Name: CVE-2011-2561
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-2561
Phase: Assigned (20110627)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20110824 Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/products_security_advisory09186a0080b8f531.shtml

The SIP process in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (aka CUCM,
formerly CallManager) 7.x before 7.1(5b)su4 and 8.x before 8.0(1) does
not properly handle SDP data within a SIP call in certain situations
related to use of the g729ar8 codec for a Media Termination Point
(MTP), which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(service outage) via a crafted call, aka Bug ID CSCtc61990.

15.0, and 15.1, and IOS XE 2.1.x through 3.3.x, when an MPLS domain is
configured, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(device crash) via a crafted IPv6 packet, related to an expired MPLS
TTL, aka Bug ID CSCto07919.

Cisco Jabber Extensible Communications Platform (aka Jabber XCP) 2.x
through 5.4.x before 5.4.0.27581 and 5.8.x before 5.8.1.27561 does not

number of nested entity references, aka Bug ID CSCtq78106, a similar
issue to CVE-2003-1564.

Category: 
Reference: MISC:http://code.google.com/p/reaver-wps/
Reference: MISC:http://sviehb.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/viehboeck_wps.pdf
Reference: MISC:http://sviehb.wordpress.com/2011/12/27/wi-fi-protected-setup-pin-brute-force-vulnerability/

Reference: URL:http://www.us-cert.gov/cas/techalerts/TA12-006A.html

Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/723755

registrar" authentication method is used, does not properly inform
clients about failed PIN authentication, which makes it easier for
remote attackers to discover the PIN value, and consequently discover
the Wi-Fi network password or reconfigure an access point, by reading
EAP-NACK messages.

Linksys PlayerPT ActiveX control 1.0.0.15 in PlayerPT.ocx on the Cisco
WVC200 Wireless-G PTZ Internet video camera allows remote attackers to
execute arbitrary code via a long URL in the first argument (aka the
sURL argument).


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/74427

before 3.4.2S, 3.5.xS before 3.5.1S, and 3.2.xSG before 3.2.2SG allows

attackers to cause a denial of service (device reload) via IGMP
packets, aka Bug ID CSCts46521.

Name: CVE-2012-4072
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-4072
Phase: Assigned (20120731)
Category:

Reference: SECTRACK:1029067
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1029067

The KVM subsystem in Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) relies on a
hardcoded X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers
to spoof SSL servers, and read keyboard and mouse events, by
leveraging knowledge of this certificate's private key, aka Bug ID
CSCte90327.

Reference: SECTRACK:1029068

(UCS) does not verify X.509 certificates from SSL servers, which
allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers, and read or
modify KVM data, via a crafted certificate, aka Bug ID CSCte90332.

Adaptive Security Appliances (ASA) 5500 series devices, and the ASA
Services Module (ASASM) in Cisco Catalyst 6500 series devices, with
software 8.3 before 8.3(2.34), 8.4 before 8.4(4.4), 8.5 before

(FWSM) 4.1 before 4.1(9) in Cisco Catalyst 6500 series switches and
7600 series routers might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code via a crafted DCERPC packet, aka Bug IDs CSCtr21359 and
CSCtr27522.

Name: CVE-2012-5958
Status: Candidate

Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130129-upnp
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-2614
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2013/dsa-2614
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-2615
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2013/dsa-2615

Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2013-02/msg00013.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#922681
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/922681
Reference: BID:57602
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/57602

Stack-based buffer overflow in the unique_service_name function in
ssdp/ssdp_server.c in the SSDP parser in the portable SDK for UPnP
Devices (aka libupnp, formerly the Intel SDK for UPnP devices) before
1.6.18 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a UDP
packet with a crafted string that is not properly handled after a
certain pointer subtraction.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-2614
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2013/dsa-2614

Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/922681
Reference: BID:57602
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/57602

Stack-based buffer overflow in the unique_service_name function in
ssdp/ssdp_server.c in the SSDP parser in the portable SDK for UPnP
Devices (aka libupnp, formerly the Intel SDK for UPnP devices) before
1.6.18 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long
UDN (aka uuid) field within a string that contains a :: (colon colon)
in a UDP packet.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2013:098
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2013:098
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2013:0255
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2013-02/msg00013.html
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#922681
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/922681
Reference: BID:57602
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/57602

Stack-based buffer overflow in the unique_service_name function in
ssdp/ssdp_server.c in the SSDP parser in the portable SDK for UPnP
Devices (aka libupnp, formerly the Intel SDK for UPnP devices) before
1.6.18 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long
UDN (aka upnp:rootdevice) field in a UDP packet.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

through 15.3, IOS-XE 2.x through 3.9.xS, ASA and PIX 7.x through 9.1,

information via a (1) unicast or (2) multicast packet, aka Bug IDs

allows local users to gain privileges via unspecified vectors, aka Bug
ID CSCud14143.

Reference: CISCO:20130528 Cisco Nexus 1000V VSM/VEM Heartbeat Denial of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1213

Cisco NX-OS on the Nexus 1000V does not assign the proper priority to
heartbeat messages from a Virtual Ethernet Module (VEM) to a Virtual
Supervisor Module (VSM), which allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (false VEM unavailability report) via a flood of UDP
packets, aka Bug ID CSCud14840.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19534
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19534
Reference: SECUNIA:55032
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/55032

mod_rewrite.c in the mod_rewrite module in the Apache HTTP Server
2.2.x before 2.2.25 writes data to a log file without sanitizing
non-printable characters, which might allow remote attackers to
execute arbitrary commands via an HTTP request containing an escape
sequence for a terminal emulator.

Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2013-08/msg00029.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2013:1341
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2013-08/msg00030.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-1903-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-1903-1
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:18835
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:18835
Reference: OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19747
Reference: URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:19747
Reference: SECUNIA:55032
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/55032

mod_dav.c in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.2.25 does not properly
determine whether DAV is enabled for a URI, which allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a
MERGE request in which the URI is configured for handling by the
mod_dav_svn module, but a certain href attribute in XML data refers to
a non-DAV URI.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/httpd/httpd/trunk/modules/session/mod_session_dbd.c?r1=1409170&r2=1488158&diff_format=h
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/CHANGES_2.4.6
Reference: CONFIRM:http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10698
Reference: CISCO:20130822 Apache HTTP Server mod_session_dbd Save Operations Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-2249

mod_session_dbd.c in the mod_session_dbd module in the Apache HTTP
Server before 2.4.5 proceeds with save operations for a session
without considering the dirty flag and the requirement for a new
session ID, which has unspecified impact and remote attack vectors.

Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20130410 Multiple Vulnerabilities in Cisco IOS XE Software for 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130410-asr1000

Cisco IOS XE 3.4 before 3.4.5S, and 3.5 through 3.7 before 3.7.1S, on
1000 series Aggregation Services Routers (ASR) does not properly
implement the Cisco Multicast Leaf Recycle Elimination (MLRE) feature,
which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (card
reload) via fragmented IPv6 MVPN (aka MVPNv6) packets, aka Bug ID
CSCub34945, a different vulnerability than CVE-2013-1164.

Reference: CISCO:20130718 Cisco IOS GET VPN Encryption Policy Bypass Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3436
Reference: OSVDB:95460
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/95460

The default configuration of the Group Encrypted Transport VPN (GET
VPN) feature on Cisco IOS uses an improper mechanism for enabling
Group Domain of Interpretation (GDOI) traffic flow, which allows
remote attackers to bypass the encryption policy via certain uses of
UDP port 848, aka Bug ID CSCui07698.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

denial of service (process crash) via a crafted version-2 RIP packet,
aka Bug ID CSCue46731.

Name: CVE-2013-4449
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-4449
Phase: Assigned (20130612)
Category: 
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20131018 Re: CVE request: slapd segfaults on certain queries with rwm overlay enabled
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/10/19/3
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.openldap.org/its/index.cgi/Incoming?id=7723
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1019490
Reference: CISCO:20140401 Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-4449
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3209
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2015/dsa-3209
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2014:026
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2014:026
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2014:0126
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-0126.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2014:0206
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-0206.html
Reference: BID:63190
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/63190
Reference: SECTRACK:1029711
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1029711

The rwm overlay in OpenLDAP 2.4.23, 2.4.36, and earlier does not
properly count references, which allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (slapd crash) by unbinding immediately after a
search request, which triggers rwm_conn_destroy to free the session
context while it is being used by rwm_op_search.

None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-4869
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-4869
Phase: Assigned (20130717)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20130717 Multiple Vulnerabilities in Cisco Unified Communications Manager
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130717-cucm
Reference: XF:cucm-cve20134869-weak-security(85883)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/85883

Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) 7.1(x) through 9.1(2) and
the IM & Presence Service in Cisco Unified Presence Server through
9.1(2) use the same CTI and database-encryption key across different
customers' installations, which makes it easier for context-dependent
attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms by leveraging
knowledge of this key, aka Bug IDs CSCsc69187 and CSCui01756.  NOTE:
the vendor has provided a statement that the "hard-coded static
encryption key is considered a hardening issue rather than a
vulnerability, and as such, has a CVSS score of 0/0."


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: BID:62083
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/62083

transitions from the ESTABLISHED state to the CLOSED state, which
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (flood of ACK
packets) via a crafted series of ACK and FIN packets, aka Bug ID
CSCtz14399.

The NTP implementation in Cisco IOS 12.0 through 12.4 and 15.0 through

encapsulation of multicast NTP packets within MSDP SA messages, which
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (device reload)
by leveraging an MSDP peer relationship, aka Bug ID CSCuc81226.

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-5558
Phase: Assigned (20130822)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20131106 Cisco TelePresence VX Clinical Assistant Administrative Password Reset Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131106-tvxca

The WIL-A module in Cisco TelePresence VX Clinical Assistant 1.2
before 1.21 changes the admin password to an empty password upon a
reboot, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access
via the administrative interface, aka Bug ID CSCuj17238.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/56273
Reference: XF:cisco-unified-cve20136983-sql-injection(90011)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/90011

SQL injection vulnerability in the web interface in Cisco Unified
Presence Server allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary
SQL commands via a crafted URL, aka Bug ID CSCuh35615.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-7030
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-7030
Phase: Assigned (20131209)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:30237
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/30237/
Reference: OSVDB:100916
Reference: URL:http://osvdb.org/100916
Reference: XF:cisco-ucm-tftp-info-disc(89649)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/89649

** DISPUTED ** The TFTP service in Cisco Unified Communications
Manager (aka CUCM or Unified CM) allows remote attackers to obtain
sensitive information from a phone via an RRQ operation, as
demonstrated by discovering a cleartext UseUserCredential field in an
SPDefault.cnf.xml file.  NOTE: the vendor reportedly disputes the
significance of this report, stating that this is an expected default
behavior, and that the product's documentation describes use of the
TFTP Encrypted Config option in addressing this issue.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2013-7043
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-7043
Phase: Assigned (20131210)
Category: 
Reference: EXPLOIT-DB:29927
Reference: URL:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/29927/
Reference: XF:cisco-scientific-cve20137043-csrf(89654)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/89654

Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities on Cisco
Scientific Atlanta DPR2320R2 routers with software 2.0.2r1262-090417
allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators
for requests that (1) change a password via the Password parameter to
goform/RgSecurity; (2) reboot the device via the Restart parameter to
goform/restart; (3) modify Wi-Fi settings, as demonstrated by the
WpaPreSharedKey parameter to goform/wlanSecurity; or (4) modify
parental controls via the ParentalPassword parameter to
goform/RgParentalBasic.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

The UPC Ireland Cisco EPC 2425 router (aka Horizon Box) does not have
a sufficiently large number of possible WPA-PSK passphrases, which
makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access via a
brute-force attack.

The Montgomery ladder implementation in OpenSSL through 1.0.0l does
not ensure that certain swap operations have a constant-time behavior,
which makes it easier for local users to obtain ECDSA nonces via a
FLUSH+RELOAD cache side-channel attack.

Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1030081
Reference: SECTRACK:1030082
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1030082
Reference: SECUNIA:57347
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/57347
Reference: SECUNIA:57483
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/57483
Reference: SECUNIA:57721
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/57721
Reference: SECUNIA:57836
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/57836
Reference: SECUNIA:57966
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/57966
Reference: SECUNIA:57968
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/57968

The (1) TLS and (2) DTLS implementations in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before
1.0.1g do not properly handle Heartbeat Extension packets, which
allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process
memory via crafted packets that trigger a buffer over-read, as
demonstrated by reading private keys, related to d1_both.c and
t1_lib.c, aka the Heartbleed bug.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59784
Reference: SECUNIA:59990
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59990
Reference: SECUNIA:60571
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60571

The dtls1_reassemble_fragment function in d1_both.c in OpenSSL before
0.9.8za, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h does not
properly validate fragment lengths in DTLS ClientHello messages, which
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (buffer overflow and application crash) via a long non-initial
fragment.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60066
Reference: SECUNIA:59784
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59784
Reference: SECUNIA:59990
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59990
Reference: SECUNIA:60571
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60571

The do_ssl3_write function in s3_pkt.c in OpenSSL 1.x through 1.0.1g,
when SSL_MODE_RELEASE_BUFFERS is enabled, does not properly manage a
buffer pointer during certain recursive calls, which allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and
application crash) via vectors that trigger an alert condition.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60687

The dtls1_get_message_fragment function in d1_both.c in OpenSSL before
0.9.8za, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (recursion and client crash)
via a DTLS hello message in an invalid DTLS handshake.

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60066
Reference: SECUNIA:59784
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59784
Reference: SECUNIA:59878
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59878
Reference: SECUNIA:59990
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59990
Reference: SECUNIA:60176
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60176
Reference: SECUNIA:60522
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60522
Reference: SECUNIA:60567
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60567
Reference: SECUNIA:60571
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60571
Reference: SECUNIA:60577
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60577
Reference: SECUNIA:60819
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60819
Reference: SECUNIA:61815
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61815

OpenSSL before 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h
does not properly restrict processing of ChangeCipherSpec messages,
which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to trigger use of a
zero-length master key in certain OpenSSL-to-OpenSSL communications,
and consequently hijack sessions or obtain sensitive information, via
a crafted TLS handshake, aka the "CCS Injection" vulnerability.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

before 5.5 does not properly enforce authentication and authorization
requirements, which allows remote attackers to obtain administrative
access via a request to this interface, aka Bug ID CSCud75187.

Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0686

Cisco Unified Communications Manager (aka Unified CM) 9.1 (2.10000.28)
and earlier allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging
incorrect file permissions, aka Bug IDs CSCul24917 and CSCul24908.

Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0694

earlier includes a cryptographic key in binary files, which makes it

CSCui34764, CSCui34772, CSCui34776, CSCui34798, CSCui34800,

authentication of administrators for requests that make administrative

URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-2129
Phase: Assigned (20140225)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20140409 Multiple Vulnerabilities in Cisco ASA Software
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140409-asa

The SIP inspection engine in Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA)
Software 8.2 before 8.2(5.48), 8.4 before 8.4(6.5), 9.0 before
9.0(3.1), and 9.1 before 9.1(2.5) allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (memory consumption or device reload) via crafted
SIP packets, aka Bug ID CSCuh44052.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-2130
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-2130
Phase: Assigned (20140225)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20150304 Cisco Secure Access Control Server Default Tomcat Administration Interface Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2130
Reference: SECTRACK:1031844
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031844

Cisco Secure Access Control Server (ACS) provides an unintentional
administration web interface based on Apache Tomcat, which allows
remote authenticated users to modify application files and
configuration files, and consequently execute arbitrary code, by
leveraging administrative privileges, aka Bug ID CSCuj83189.

denial of service (device reload) via a series of (1) Virtual
Switching Systems (VSS) or (2) Bidirectional Forwarding Detection
(BFD) packets, aka Bug IDs CSCug41049 and CSCue61890.

Phase: Assigned (20140225)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20140507 Multiple Vulnerabilities in the Cisco WebEx Recording Format and Advanced Recording Format Players
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140507-webex

Cisco WebEx Recording Format (WRF) player and Advanced Recording
Format (ARF) player T27 LD before SP32 EP16, T28 before T28.12, and
T29 before T29.2 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(application crash) via a crafted (1) .wrf or (2) .arf file that
triggers a buffer over-read, aka Bug ID CSCuh52768.

Category:

Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140507-webex

Buffer overflow in Cisco Advanced Recording Format (ARF) player T27 LD
before SP32 EP16, T28 before T28.12, and T29 before T29.2 allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted .arf
file that triggers improper LZW decompression, aka Bug ID CSCuj87565.

Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3262
Phase: Assigned (20140507)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=34233
Reference: CISCO:20140514 Cisco IOS Software and IOS XE Software LISP Denial of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3262
Reference: SECTRACK:1030243
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1030243

The Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP) implementation in Cisco IOS
15.3(3)S and earlier and IOS XE does not properly validate parameters
in ITR control messages, which allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (CEF outage and packet drops) via malformed
messages, aka Bug ID CSCun73782.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Communications Manager (UCM) to block HTTPS traffic, aka Bug ID

Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1030274

not properly handle deadlock conditions during reception of crafted
RADIUS accounting packets from multiple NAS devices, which allows
remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (RADIUS
outage) by sourcing these packets from two origins, aka Bug ID
CSCuo56780.

interact with autonomic networking, which allows remote attackers to
obtain sensitive networking-services information by sniffing the
network or overwrite networking-services data via a crafted mDNS
response, aka Bug ID CSCun64867.

Category:

Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3351

not properly consider whether a session is a problematic NULL session,
which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via
crafted packets, aka Bug IDs CSCuh87398 and CSCuh87380.

Reference: SECUNIA:59451
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59451
Reference: SECUNIA:59916
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59916
Reference: SECUNIA:59784
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59784
Reference: SECUNIA:59990
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59990
Reference: SECUNIA:60571
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60571

The ssl3_send_client_key_exchange function in s3_clnt.c in OpenSSL
before 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h, when an
anonymous ECDH cipher suite is used, allows remote attackers to cause
a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and client crash) by
triggering a NULL certificate value.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61810

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60206

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60859
Reference: SECUNIA:61130
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61130
Reference: SECUNIA:61316
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61316
Reference: SECUNIA:61819
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61819
Reference: SECUNIA:59627
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59627
Reference: SECUNIA:61926
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61926
Reference: SECUNIA:61995
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61995

The SSL protocol 3.0, as used in OpenSSL through 1.0.1i and other
products, uses nondeterministic CBC padding, which makes it easier for
man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain cleartext data via a
padding-oracle attack, aka the "POODLE" issue.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2014-3569
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-3569

Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2014/CVE-2014-3569.html
