Reference: CISCO:20150310 Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (January 2015) Affecting Cisco Products
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150310-ssl
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3125
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2015/dsa-3125
Reference: HP:HPSBUX03244
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142496289803847&w=2
Reference: HP:SSRT101885
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142496289803847&w=2
Reference: HP:HPSBHF03289
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142721102728110&w=2
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:019
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:019
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0130
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-01/msg00021.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0946
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-05/msg00026.html
Reference: BID:71934
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/71934

The ssl23_get_client_hello function in s23_srvr.c in OpenSSL 0.9.8zc,
1.0.0o, and 1.0.1j does not properly handle attempts to use
unsupported protocols, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial
of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an
unexpected handshake, as demonstrated by an SSLv3 handshake to a
no-ssl3 application with certain error handling.  NOTE: this issue
became relevant after the CVE-2014-3568 fix.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142721102728110&w=2
Reference: HP:SSRT101987
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142720981827617&w=2
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:019
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:019
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0066
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0066.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0849
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0849.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0130
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-01/msg00021.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0578
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-03/msg00027.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0946
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-05/msg00026.html
Reference: BID:71939
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/71939

The BN_sqr implementation in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zd, 1.0.0 before
1.0.0p, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k does not properly calculate the square
of a BIGNUM value, which might make it easier for remote attackers to
defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms via unspecified vectors,
related to crypto/bn/asm/mips.pl, crypto/bn/asm/x86_64-gcc.c, and
crypto/bn/bn_asm.c.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: APPLE:APPLE-SA-2015-04-08-2
Reference: URL:http://lists.apple.com/archives/security-announce/2015/Apr/msg00001.html
Reference: CISCO:20150310 Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (January 2015) Affecting Cisco Products
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150310-ssl
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3125
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2015/dsa-3125
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-0512
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2015-January/147938.html
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-0601
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2015-January/148363.html
Reference: HP:HPSBUX03244
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142496289803847&w=2
Reference: HP:SSRT101885
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142496289803847&w=2
Reference: HP:HPSBHF03289
Reference: URL:http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=142721102728110&w=2
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:019
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:019
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0066
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0066.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0130
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-01/msg00021.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0946
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-05/msg00026.html
Reference: BID:71937
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/71937

OpenSSL before 0.9.8zd, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0p, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer
dereference and application crash) via a crafted DTLS message that is
processed with a different read operation for the handshake header
than for the handshake body, related to the dtls1_get_record function
in d1_pkt.c and the ssl3_read_n function in s3_pkt.c.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0066
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0066.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0130
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-01/msg00021.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0578
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-03/msg00027.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0946
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-05/msg00026.html
Reference: BID:71942
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/71942

The ssl3_get_key_exchange function in s3_clnt.c in OpenSSL before
0.9.8zd, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0p, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k allows remote
SSL servers to conduct ECDHE-to-ECDH downgrade attacks and trigger a
loss of forward secrecy by omitting the ServerKeyExchange message.

Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2014:1110
Reference: URL:https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1110.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2014:1118
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1118.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2014:1125
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2014-09/msg00017.html
Reference: BID:68983
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/68983

Off-by-one error in the __gconv_translit_find function in
gconv_trans.c in GNU C Library (aka glibc) allows context-dependent
attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary
code via vectors related to the CHARSET environment variable and gconv
transliteration modules.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-5710
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-5710
Phase: Assigned (20140830)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1t5GXwjw82SyunALVJb2w0zi3FoLRIkfGPc7AMjRF0r4/edit?usp=sharing

The Cisco Class Locator Fast Lane (aka
com.tabletkings.mycompany.fastlane.cisco) application for Android does
not verify X.509 certificates from SSL servers, which allows
man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers and obtain sensitive
information via a crafted certificate.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-5868
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-5868
Phase: Assigned (20140830)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1t5GXwjw82SyunALVJb2w0zi3FoLRIkfGPc7AMjRF0r4/edit?usp=sharing
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#582497
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/582497
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#698569
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/698569

The Cisco Technical Support (aka com.cisco.swtg_android) application
3.7.1 for Android does not verify X.509 certificates from SSL servers,
which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers and obtain
sensitive information via a crafted certificate.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61550
Reference: SECUNIA:61780
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61780
Reference: SECUNIA:61816
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61816
Reference: SECUNIA:61855
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61855
Reference: SECUNIA:61857
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61857
Reference: SECUNIA:60024
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60024
Reference: SECUNIA:60063
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60063
Reference: SECUNIA:60044
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60044
Reference: SECUNIA:60433
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60433
Reference: SECUNIA:61291
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61291
Reference: SECUNIA:61873
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61873
Reference: SECUNIA:62312
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62312
Reference: SECUNIA:62343
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62343

GNU Bash through 4.3 processes trailing strings after function
definitions in the values of environment variables, which allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted environment,
as demonstrated by vectors involving the ForceCommand feature in
OpenSSH sshd, the mod_cgi and mod_cgid modules in the Apache HTTP
Server, scripts executed by unspecified DHCP clients, and other
situations in which setting the environment occurs across a privilege
boundary from Bash execution, aka "ShellShock."  NOTE: the original
fix for this issue was incorrect; CVE-2014-7169 has been assigned to
cover the vulnerability that is still present after the incorrect fix.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECUNIA:61857

Reference: SECUNIA:60024
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60024
Reference: SECUNIA:60063
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60063
Reference: SECUNIA:60044
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60044
Reference: SECUNIA:60433
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60433
Reference: SECUNIA:61291
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61291
Reference: SECUNIA:59961
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/59961
Reference: SECUNIA:62312
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62312
Reference: SECUNIA:62343
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62343

GNU Bash through 4.3 bash43-026 does not properly parse function
definitions in the values of environment variables, which allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of
service (uninitialized memory access, and untrusted-pointer read and
write operations) via a crafted environment, as demonstrated by
vectors involving the ForceCommand feature in OpenSSH sshd, the
mod_cgi and mod_cgid modules in the Apache HTTP Server, scripts
executed by unspecified DHCP clients, and other situations in which
setting the environment occurs across a privilege boundary from Bash
execution.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete
fix for CVE-2014-6271 and CVE-2014-7169.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECUNIA:62312
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62312
Reference: SECUNIA:62343
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62343

GNU Bash through 4.3 bash43-026 does not properly parse function
definitions in the values of environment variables, which allows
remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a crafted
environment, as demonstrated by vectors involving the ForceCommand
feature in OpenSSH sshd, the mod_cgi and mod_cgid modules in the
Apache HTTP Server, scripts executed by unspecified DHCP clients, and
other situations in which setting the environment occurs across a
privilege boundary from Bash execution.  NOTE: this vulnerability
exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-6271, CVE-2014-7169,
and CVE-2014-6277.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECUNIA:60024
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60024
Reference: SECUNIA:60063
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60063
Reference: SECUNIA:60044
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60044
Reference: SECUNIA:60433
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/60433
Reference: SECUNIA:61291
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61291
Reference: SECUNIA:61873
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61873
Reference: SECUNIA:62312
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62312
Reference: SECUNIA:62343
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62343

GNU Bash through 4.3 bash43-025 processes trailing strings after
certain malformed function definitions in the values of environment
variables, which allows remote attackers to write to files or possibly
have unknown other impact via a crafted environment, as demonstrated
by vectors involving the ForceCommand feature in OpenSSH sshd, the
mod_cgi and mod_cgid modules in the Apache HTTP Server, scripts
executed by unspecified DHCP clients, and other situations in which
setting the environment occurs across a privilege boundary from Bash
execution.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete
fix for CVE-2014-6271.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECUNIA:62312
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62312
Reference: SECUNIA:62343
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62343

The redirection implementation in parse.y in GNU Bash through 4.3
bash43-026 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(out-of-bounds array access and application crash) or possibly have
unspecified other impact via crafted use of here documents, aka the
"redir_stack" issue.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: SECUNIA:61873
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/61873
Reference: SECUNIA:62312
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62312
Reference: SECUNIA:62343
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62343

Off-by-one error in the read_token_word function in parse.y in GNU
Bash through 4.3 bash43-026 allows remote attackers to cause a denial
of service (out-of-bounds array access and application crash) or
possibly have unspecified other impact via deeply nested for loops,
aka the "word_lineno" issue.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

earlier allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive
information by reading log files, aka Bug ID CSCur06493.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-7990
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-7990
Phase: Assigned (20141008)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=36351
Reference: CISCO:20141106 Cisco IOS XE Challenge/Response Bypass Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7990
Reference: BID:70968
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/70968
Reference: SECTRACK:1031179
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031179
Reference: XF:ciscoiosxe-cve20147990-sec-bypass(98529)
Reference: URL:http://xforce.iss.net/xforce/xfdb/98529

Cisco IOS XE 3.5E and earlier on WS-C3850, WS-C3860, and AIR-CT5760
devices does not properly parse the "request system shell" challenge
response, which allows local users to obtain Linux root access by
leveraging administrative privilege, aka Bug ID CSCur09815.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-7991
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-7991
Phase: Assigned (20141008)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=36381
Reference: CISCO:20141110 Cisco Unified Communications Manager Remote Mobile Access Subsystem Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7991
Reference: SECUNIA:62267
Reference: URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/62267

The Remote Mobile Access Subsystem in Cisco Unified Communications
Manager (CM) 10.0(1) and earlier does not properly validate the
Subject Alternative Name (SAN) field of an X.509 certificate, which
allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof VCS core devices via a
crafted certificate issued by a legitimate Certification Authority,
aka Bug ID CSCuq86376.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-7992
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-7992
Phase: Assigned (20141008)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=36453
Reference: CISCO:20141117 Cisco IOS DLSw Information Disclosure Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7992

The DLSw implementation in Cisco IOS does not initialize packet
buffers, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive credential
information from process memory via a session on TCP port 2067, aka
Bug ID CSCur14014.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2014-7996

======================================================
Name: CVE-2014-7997
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-7997
Phase: Assigned (20141008)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20141114 Cisco Aironet DHCP Denial of Service Vulnerabilty
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7997

The DHCP implementation in Cisco IOS on Aironet access points does not
properly handle error conditions with short leases and unsuccessful
lease-renewal attempts, which allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (device restart) by triggering a transition into a
recovery state that was intended to involve a network-interface
restart but actually involves a full device restart, aka Bug ID
CSCtn16281.

None (candidate not yet proposed)

does not enforce certain constraints on certificate data, which allows
remote attackers to defeat a fingerprint-based certificate-blacklist
protection mechanism by including crafted data within a certificate's
unsigned portion, related to crypto/asn1/a_verify.c,
crypto/dsa/dsa_asn1.c, crypto/ecdsa/ecs_vrf.c, and
crypto/x509/x_all.c.

Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:019
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:062
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:063
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:063
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0066
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0066.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0800
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0800.html
Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0849
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0849.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0130
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-01/msg00021.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0578
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-03/msg00027.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0946
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-05/msg00026.html

The ssl3_get_key_exchange function in s3_clnt.c in OpenSSL before
0.9.8zd, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0p, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k allows remote
SSL servers to conduct RSA-to-EXPORT_RSA downgrade attacks and
facilitate brute-force decryption by offering a weak ephemeral RSA key
in a noncompliant role, related to the "FREAK" issue.  NOTE: the scope
of this CVE is only client code based on OpenSSL, not EXPORT_RSA
issues associated with servers or other TLS implementations.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-0601

Reference: REDHAT:RHSA-2015:0066
Reference: URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0066.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0130
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-01/msg00021.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0578
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-03/msg00027.html
Reference: SUSE:SUSE-SU-2015:0946
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2015-05/msg00026.html

The ssl3_get_cert_verify function in s3_srvr.c in OpenSSL 1.0.0 before
1.0.0p and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k accepts client authentication with a
Diffie-Hellman (DH) certificate without requiring a CertificateVerify
message, which allows remote attackers to obtain access without
knowledge of a private key via crafted TLS Handshake Protocol traffic
to a server that recognizes a Certification Authority with DH support.

1.0.0 before 1.0.0p and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k allows remote attackers to
cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by sending many
duplicate records for the next epoch, leading to failure of replay
detection.

Heap-based buffer overflow in the __nss_hostname_digits_dots function
in glibc 2.2, and other 2.x versions before 2.18, allows
context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors
related to the (1) gethostbyname or (2) gethostbyname2 function, aka
"GHOST."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-0607
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-0607
Phase: Assigned (20150107)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=37711
Reference: CISCO:20150226 Cisco IOS Software Authentication Proxy Bypass Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0607
Reference: BID:72794
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/72794
Reference: SECTRACK:1031817
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031817

The Authentication Proxy feature in Cisco IOS does not properly handle
invalid AAA return codes from RADIUS and TACACS+ servers, which allows
remote attackers to bypass authentication in opportunistic
circumstances via a connection attempt that triggers an invalid code,
as demonstrated by a connection attempt with a blank password, aka Bug
IDs CSCuo09400 and CSCun16016.

configured, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(interface queue wedge) via crafted ICMPv4 packets, aka Bug ID
CSCsi02145.

implementation in Cisco Unified MeetingPlace 8.6(1.9) allows remote
authenticated users to execute arbitrary code by using the
languageShortName parameter to upload a file that provides shell
access, aka Bug ID CSCus95712.

Reference: CISCO:20150520 Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance Protocol Independent Multicast Registration Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38937

The Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) application in Cisco Adaptive
Security Appliance (ASA) Software 9.2(0.0), 9.2(0.104), 9.2(3.1),
9.2(3.4), 9.3(1.105), 9.3(2.100), 9.4(0.115), 100.13(0.21),
100.13(20.3), 100.13(21.9), and 100.14(1.1) does not properly
implement multicast-forwarding registration, which allows remote
attackers to cause a denial of service (forwarding outage) via a
crafted multicast packet, aka Bug ID CSCus74398.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-1798
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-1798
Phase: Assigned (20150217)
Category: 
Reference: CONFIRM:http://bugs.ntp.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2779
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.ntp.org/bin/view/Main/SecurityNotice#Recent_Vulnerabilities
Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10114
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT204942
Reference: APPLE:APPLE-SA-2015-06-30-2
Reference: URL:http://lists.apple.com/archives/security-announce/2015/Jun/msg00002.html
Reference: CISCO:20150408 Multiple Vulnerabilities in ntpd (April 2015) Affecting Cisco Products
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd
Reference: CISCO:20150408 Network Time Protocol Daemon MAC Checking Failure Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38276
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3223
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2015/dsa-3223
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-5761
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2015-April/155864.html
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-5874
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2015-April/155863.html
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:202
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:202
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0775
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2015-04/msg00052.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-2567-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-2567-1
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#374268
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/374268
Reference: BID:73951
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/73951
Reference: SECTRACK:1032032
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1032032

The symmetric-key feature in the receive function in ntp_proto.c in
ntpd in NTP 4.x before 4.2.8p2 requires a correct MAC only if the MAC
field has a nonzero length, which makes it easier for
man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof packets by omitting the MAC.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Name: CVE-2015-1799
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-1799

Category:

Reference: CONFIRM:https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10114
Reference: CONFIRM:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT204942
Reference: APPLE:APPLE-SA-2015-06-30-2
Reference: URL:http://lists.apple.com/archives/security-announce/2015/Jun/msg00002.html
Reference: CISCO:20150408 Multiple Vulnerabilities in ntpd (April 2015) Affecting Cisco Products
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd
Reference: CISCO:20150408 Network Time Protocol Daemon Symmetric Mode Packet Processing Denial of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38275
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3222
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2015/dsa-3222
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-3223
Reference: URL:http://www.debian.org/security/2015/dsa-3223
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-5761
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2015-April/155864.html
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2015-5874
Reference: URL:http://lists.fedoraproject.org/pipermail/package-announce/2015-April/155863.html
Reference: MANDRIVA:MDVSA-2015:202
Reference: URL:http://www.mandriva.com/security/advisories?name=MDVSA-2015:202
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0775
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2015-04/msg00052.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-2567-1
Reference: URL:http://www.ubuntu.com/usn/USN-2567-1
Reference: CERT-VN:VU#374268
Reference: URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/374268
Reference: BID:73950
Reference: URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/73950
Reference: SECTRACK:1032031
Reference: URL:http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1032031

The symmetric-key feature in the receive function in ntp_proto.c in
ntpd in NTP 3.x and 4.x before 4.2.8p2 performs state-variable updates
upon receiving certain invalid packets, which makes it easier for
man-in-the-middle attackers to cause a denial of service
(synchronization loss) by spoofing the source IP address of a peer.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

Reference: CISCO:20150625 Multiple Default SSH Keys Vulnerabilities in Cisco Virtual WSA, ESA, and SMA
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150625-ironport

The remote-support feature on Cisco Web Security Virtual Appliance
(WSAv), Email Security Virtual Appliance (ESAv), and Security
Management Virtual Appliance (SMAv) devices before 2015-06-25 uses the
same default SSH root authorized key across different customers'
installations, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass
authentication by leveraging knowledge of a private key from another
installation, aka Bug IDs CSCuu95988, CSCuu95994, and CSCuu96630.

does not properly restrict access to encrypted passwords, which allows
remote attackers to determine cleartext passwords, and consequently
execute arbitrary commands, by visiting an unspecified web page and
then conducting a decryption attack, aka Bug ID CSCuq46194.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)

packets, aka Bug IDs CSCtf87624, CSCte93229, CSCtd19103, and

implement the Control Plane Protection (aka CPPr) feature, which
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (device reload)

Name: CVE-2015-6331
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-6331
Phase: Assigned (20150817)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20151008 Cisco Prime Collaboration Assurance SQL Injection Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151008-pca2

SQL injection vulnerability in the web framework in Cisco Prime
Collaboration Assurance 10.5(1) allows remote authenticated users to
execute arbitrary SQL commands via unspecified vectors, aka Bug ID
CSCus39887.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-6332
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-6332
Phase: Assigned (20150817)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20151008 Cisco Prime Renegotiation Request Denial of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151008-cpi

Cisco Prime Infrastructure 2.2 allows remote attackers to cause a
denial of service (daemon hang) by sending many SSL renegotiation
requests, aka Bug ID CSCuv56830.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-6333
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-6333
Phase: Assigned (20150817)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20151012 Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller Privilege Escalation SSH Key Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151012-apic

Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) 1.1j allows
local users to gain privileges via vectors involving addition of an
SSH key, aka Bug ID CSCuw46076.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-6334
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-6334
Phase: Assigned (20150817)
Category: 
Reference: CISCO:20151012 Cisco ASR 5000 and ASR 5500 TACACS Denial of Service Vulnerability
Reference: URL:http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151012-asr

Cisco ASR 5000 and 5500 devices with software 18.0.0.57828 and
19.0.M0.61045 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(vpnmgr process restart) via a crafted header in a TACACS packet, aka
Bug ID CSCuw01984.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)


======================================================
Name: CVE-2015-7600
Status: Candidate
URL: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-7600
Phase: Assigned (20150929)
Category: 
Reference: MISC:https://www.nettitude.co.uk/vulnerability-discovered-in-unsupported-cisco-systems-vpn-client/

Cisco VPN Client 5.x through 5.0.07.0440 uses weak permissions for
vpnclient.ini, which allows local users to gain privileges by entering
an arbitrary program name in the Command field of the
ApplicationLauncher section.


Current Votes:
None (candidate not yet proposed)
